name: Greenhouse Gas Giants
title: Highest Greenhouse Gas Emissions Growth
description: Equatorial Guinea has seen a staggering increase in greenhouse gas emissions, with a 3674% rise since 1990, marking one of the highest growth rates globally as of 2023.

name: Methane Madness
title: Explosive Methane Emissions Growth
description: Methane emissions in Equatorial Guinea have surged by 2942% since 1990, highlighting a significant environmental challenge as of 2023.

name: Banking on the Edge
title: High Nonperforming Loans Ratio
description: In 2022, Equatorial Guinea's banks reported that 55.41% of their loans were nonperforming, indicating a critical issue in the financial sector.

name: Capital Crunch
title: Lowest Bank Capital to Assets Ratio
description: With a bank capital to assets ratio of just 1.15% in 2022, Equatorial Guinea's financial stability is under significant pressure.

name: Education Exodus
title: High Rate of Children Out of School
description: As of 2015, 62.33% of male children of primary school age were out of school, reflecting a major educational challenge.

name: Teacher Training Troubles
title: Low Percentage of Trained Teachers
description: Only 11.19% of teachers in lower secondary education were trained in 2015, highlighting a gap in educational quality.

name: Renewable Retreat
title: Negative Renewable Energy Production
description: In 2021, Equatorial Guinea reported a -23.72% production from renewable sources, excluding hydroelectric, indicating a decline in sustainable energy efforts.

name: Voice Void
title: Low Voice and Accountability Rank
description: Equatorial Guinea ranks low in voice and accountability, with a percentile rank of 0.48 in 2022, suggesting limited political freedoms.
